text: , also known as the Heisei era, is the after Shōwa and before Reiwa. This period started in February 1989Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2002). "Heisei" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 306. and ended on April 30, 2019 with the emperor's abdication.BBC NEWS. (2017). Japan's Emperor Akihito to abdicate in April 2019 During this time, the emperor was ,Nussbaum, "Akihito" at p. 19. ==Events of the Heisei period== The years in which Akihito has been the Japanese monarch comprise this period or era. Retrieved 2011-12-15. * 11 March 2011 (Heisei 23, 11th day of the 3rd month): A magnitude 9.0 earthquake caused a great tsunami, known as the 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunamiUSGS, "Magnitude 9.0 Near the east coast of Honshu, Japan" .
